title: Numerals
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830001216im_/http:/typophile.com/files/assorted_numerals_found_at_jvscorelstraat_5957.png)

Ideas anyone? I do not know if there are letters too or whether this is a numeral-only face.

 [‹ ID Quirky serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830001216/http:/typophile.com/node/43197 "Go to previous forum topic") [American Chemistry Council Essential2 typeface ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830001216/http:/typophile.com/node/43201 "Go to next forum topic")
author: vdHummes

comments.content:
Very stylish, with a sort of Art Nouveau quality to it. I’m curious about the answer to this too. Doesn’t look like anything I can recall seeing.

- Mike Yanega
just curious, but do you have any pics of the buidings those are attached to?

Searched FontShop and MyFonts using terms for high contrast and found one with a similar concept, but not Nouveau-ish, called [Oak Park](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830001216/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ingrimayne/oakpark/) by Robert Schenk. Interestingly, he uses these numerals again in another of his fonts, [Grandecort](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830001216/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ingrimayne/grandecort/).

Closest FontShop result was [Linotype Breeze](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830001216/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/breeze_virtual/?sample_text=0123456789).

- Mike Yanega

To illustrate why I keep saying “Art Nouveau” look at the numerals from [Skjald](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830001216/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Skjald&x=12&y=9&sample_text=0123456789), from ATF, and [Artistik](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830001216/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/artistik/?sample_text=0123456789) from Bauer in Berlin.

- Mike Yanega

p.s. Stewf, any chance FontShop could keep sample text set by the user until it is reset or changed? It’s a pain to keep re-doing it for each page.
